body_html:
I think all that code belonged in seq2seq_legacy, it doesn't seem to really be a good fit for the new seq2seq API.
…
On Jan 18, 2017 11:08 AM, "Asim Shankar" ***@***.***> wrote: contrib and its submodules are not covered by API stability guarantees, so we do have an opportunity to change them. This was introduced in PR #4382 <#4382> @lukaszkaiser <https://github.com/lukaszkaiser> @ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo> : Any opinions here? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. I think all that code belonged in seq2seq_legacy, it doesn't seem to really
be a good fit for the new seq2seq API.
…

 #4382 <#4382>

body:
I think all that code belonged in seq2seq_legacy, it doesn't seem to really
be a good fit for the new seq2seq API.

On Jan 18, 2017 11:08 AM, "Asim Shankar" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> contrib and its submodules are not covered by API stability guarantees,
> so we do have an opportunity to change them. This was introduced in PR
> #4382 <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4382>
>
> @lukaszkaiser <https://github.com/lukaszkaiser> @ebrevdo
> <https://github.com/ebrevdo> : Any opinions here?
>
> —
